task.title: Register the Storage Controller
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to register a Storage Controller (SC) with the Cloud Controller (CLC).

ul.li: The Cloud Controller must be properly installed and started.
The Storage Controller service must be properly installed and started.

context.b: To register the Storage Controller service with the Eucalyptus cloud

step.cmd: Copy the security credentials from the CLC to each machine running Storage Controller services.
step.info: (Optional) Repeat this step for each zone.

step.cmd: On the CLC host machine, enter the following command:

ul.li: IP is the IP of the SC you are registering with this CLC.
URL bootstrap service endpoint URL is temporarily required until Eucalyptus DNS and other endpoint services are configured.
ZONE name should be a descriptive name for the availability zone controlled by the CC. For example: zone-1. An SC must have the same ZONE name as the CC in the same zone.
SVCINSTANCE must be a unique name for the SC service. We recommend that you use a short-hand name of the hostname or IP address of the machine, for example: sc-[hostname] or sc-[IP address].

info.note: We recommend that you use IP addresses instead of DNS names when registering Eucalyptus services.

The SC automatically goes to the BROKEN state after being registered with the CLC; it will remain in that state until you explicitly configure the SC by configuring the backend storage provider. For more information, see About the BROKEN state.
